title: Indo-Greek Kingdom
summary: The Indo-Greek Kingdom, or Graeco-Indian Kingdom, also known historically as the Yavana Kingdom (Yavanarajya),[3] was a Hellenistic-era Greek kingdom covering various parts of Afghanistan and the northwest regions of the Indian subcontinent (parts of modern Pakistan and northwestern India),[4][5][6][7][8][9] which existed during the last two centuries BC and was ruled by over 30 kings, Menander, being the most illustrious and successful.
